application_instruction: Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Sunnyvale, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA
description:
Google's projects, like our users, span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique engineering challenges we face daily. As a Technical Program Manager at Google, you lead complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your engineering expertise. You plan requirements with internal customers and usher projects through the entire project lifecycle. This includes managing project schedules, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders. You're equally at home explaining your team's analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers.

Our team focuses on new product initiatives in Security, Trust, and Data Protection for G Suite, allowing Google to provide greater visibility, transparency, access management, and controls, Data Governance and compliance to Enterprise Cloud Customers.

As a Technical Program Manager, you will use your experience in technical program management to mobilize cross-functional teams, deliver solutions for scale and data-drive decision-making, and refine, launch, and take to market solutions that accelerate our customers' success in the cloud.

The web is what you make of it and our team is helping the world make more of the web. From open-source pros to user-experience extraordinaires, we develop products that help users connect, communicate and collaborate with others. Our consumer products and cloud platforms are giving millions of users at homes, businesses, universities and nonprofits around the world the tools that shape their web experience -- and changing the way they think about computing.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business, related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  • 5 years of experience in privacy, security, data protection.
  • 5 years of experience in engineering leadership/management or technical program management within a technology environment.
  • Experience with established and/or emerging compliance programs around the globe (e.g. HIPAA, FedRAMP, GDPR, FERPA).

Preferred qualifications:

  • 5 years of development experience.
  • Experience supporting parallel programs at scale in technical environments.
  • Experience with complex system architecture and design, technical troubleshooting, security and privacy standards.
  • Ability to influence Engineering and Product Management teams to improve product features, QA processes, and/or the maintenance of a product offering by identifying problems and suggesting and/or driving implementation of fixes or features.
  • Ability to manage complex and/or cross-functional projects and apply your skills in a data-driven environment.
  • Ability to comfortably speak in technical and non-technical business contexts with excellent communications skills.
responsibilities:
• Lead new product introduction (NPI) programs for Google Cloud.
  • Build the next generation of features and tools to improve transparency in Google Cloud.
  • Influence product priorities, design, engineering, and test.
  • Advocate the mission, metrics, and results of efforts achieved within Google.
  • Collaborate with other Google functions to align communications and improve broad awareness.
title: Technical Program Manager, Security and Data Protection, G Suite
